page.title: 12Watton Priory
page.content: After the surrender of the monastery, the Prior's lodging was retained as a mansion and the other buildings were dismantled and eventually demolished. The area of the nunnery is still known as "The Nuns", and the surrounding farmland belongs to Watton Abbey Farm, belonging to Mr. A. Pexton. Traditions surround the Priory site. One story maintains there is a subterranean passage between the convent and a holy well at Kilnwick called "The Lady's Well". The nuns are said to have performed wonderful cures by means of this water. A woman and child, hiding in a Priory room during the Civil War, are said to have been murdered there by soldiers who entered by a secret door. The headless woman, carrying her child, is supposed to haunt the Priory. So,too, is the figure of a tall monk.
